data.title: Letter-spacing does not work in Japanese
The program can't start because chromiumcontent.dll is missing from your computer
data.body:
Just installed Atom 1.0.2 on Windows 8 x64, I get this error on first launch.

![Error screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/kXkM066.png)

It seems that everything is working just fine anyway.

data.title: Differing snippet behaviour
data.body:
I have just received an [issue](https://github.com/idleberg/atom-semantic-ui/issues/2#issuecomment-121737883) for one a package of Atom snippets. The package in question was converted from Sublime Text and it used `.text.html -text.html.markdown` as scope. Now, I know that Atom uses `source.gfm` for Markdown, but that's not the point here. The snippets worked perfectly on Mac OS X using that scope, but they did not work at all on Windows. Thought that you might want to look into that.

However, I was wondering if Atom even supports scope in the mentioned format, would `.text.html -source.gfm` be a valid scope (I'm not near my computer, otherwise I'd simply test it)

data.title: config onDidChange does not return keypath in event
data.body:
Per docs (https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.0.2/src/config.coffee#L418) there should be oldValue, newValue, keyPath in the event passed to the callback. In fact only the first two are present

I think https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.0.2/src/config.coffee#L871 is the issue. Correct?

data.title: Branch undo
data.body:
One very useful feature that vim has is undo branching. This feature can be a real life saver. Let's say I make some changes, undo them, and then start typing again, only to realize that I needed some of those other changes. Without undo branches, those changes are gone. With them, I am free from worry about losing work!

See: http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Using_undo_branches

It would be so nice for Atom to have this as well!

data.title: Support descriptions for enum values in config.
data.body:
The "enum" property may now specify options as a list of [value,
description] pairs.

This goes with atom/settings-view#589.

data.title: I can't install atom (windows 7): "Installation has failed: Failed to extract installer"
data.body:
I downloaded the installer from the official site and when I run it, I get the error message in the title.  I've been researching this issue and I've found that problem may lie in Update.exe.  When I go to

C:\Users\myname\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp

I find the Update.exe file.  I can open and edit all other files in this directory, but when I try to open Update.exe, I get the error:

"Windows cannot access the specified device, path, or file.  You may not have the appropriate permissions to access the item."

But when I look at the security tab in the properties dialog of Update.exe, it shows that my account has full access.

I have no idea how to fix this issue.

data.title: File search not working directly after restart, needs to index files every time first
data.body:
After every restart, the Ctrl+P search is not working immediately. All files have to be indexed first. For big projects this can take some time.

Instead the index should be cached to make the search immediately available instead of blocking it. Of course it can then index in the background.

data.title: Empty Untitled Tabs Remain When Reopening Project
data.body:
If you follow these steps:
1. Open a project (folder)
2. Press [ctrl] + [n] to create a new empty tab
3. Close project/Atom window
4. Reopen project
There will be an empty _untitled tab_ open. Im not sure if this is an inteneded behavior or just a by product of session saving.
This behavior happens even with `--safe`

I believe the empty tab should be removed on exit.

Using version 1.0.2 on Fedora (Linux)

data.title: Chews a lot of Memory on my  Mac Book Pro
data.body: I think this is a wonderful tool, and it has a great future. Comparing to most common IDE such as Eclipse this tools hogs a lot of memory considering it's just a text editor. When used I can see my memory  go down from 8gb to 2gb once start using it and the response is really slow. I have a Mac Book Pro with 16GB I can run Photoshop, IDE, two browsers with multiple tabs and I don't see any performance issue, but if I open Atom with 2 browser it lags and performance is really bad.

data.title: Atom doesn't take focus when file is opened on opened window.
data.body: On Linux (Ubuntu 14.04 - both Unity and GNOME) Atom does not ask my system for focus when a new file is opened on a previously opened file, this could be related to the fact that we split our dev across multiple desktops across multiple screens but ultimately it never even asks for focus.

data.title: [Feature Request] Open File opens dialog in current folder of current active file
data.body: When choosing to open a new file it would be nice if atom would open the dialog in the directory of the currently opened and active file.

data.title: [Feature request] Add Inline Editors feature, just like brackets
data.body: This is a very useful function. No matter it appears in another pane or in a pop-up, or exactly like brackets.

data.title: can't import number in html file on mac ?
data.body:
atom version is 1.0.2
mac 10.10
i can import number in any files except html

who came the similar problem ? i doubt it is some package conflict

data.title: [Feature request] Dialog with unsaved changes should accept "Don't save all"
data.body: Hey, when working on a large project I often find myself opening lots of files that I often forgot to close (and sometimes they are deleted from the filesystem while still being opened). When I am about to close the project, I need to click "Don't save" more than 30 times to close it. It would be really nice to have "No to all" option that I can just click (in my case, I am using source control so I am pretty sure all changes I wanted to save were already committed). That's the dialog I am talking about:

data.title: :apple: Add more subword navigation keybindings for Mac OS X
data.body:
These `alt`-less variants are commonly available in Mac OS X apps --
such as Sublime Text 3, TextMate 2, and Xcode.

Related pull request to change a conflicting `ctrl-backspace` keybinding:
https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/pull/154

data.title: Showing line numbers disables sub-pixel AA on tabs, status-bar etc.
data.body:
In https://github.com/atom/one-dark-ui/issues/82, @wiox noticed that sub-pixel anti aliasing is not only disabled for the tabs, but also on the fuzzy finder and the status bar.

![sub-pixel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/8694250/9299865a-2b18-11e5-8f8d-936466ccedf6.png)

It seems it's caused by the line number tiles getting promoted to a GPU layer and probably related to #7101. Kinda strange that it affects different areas.

Something that might be worth looking into is using `will-change`. It also adds a GPU layer for the line numbers, but doesn't affect the rest. Notice the orange "composited layer borders" only appear in the status bar with `-webkit-transform: translate3d(0px, 0px, 0px);` but not with `will-change: transform;`.

![tiles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/8694309/0dae2350-2b19-11e5-8506-7201ba42ae5e.gif)

Now, I _heard_ that `will-change` should only be used when interacting, like on hover or so.. and not kept permanently enabled. So not sure if that would help. /cc @as-cii @nathansobo 

**Edit:** Sorry, I just realized that the `transform` is needed to actually move line numbers. So can't be replaced. :grin:

data.title: Sidebar menu: add a "Copy Relative Path" item?
data.body:
When right-clicking on a file in the sidebar, we already have:
- Copy Full Path
- Copy Project Path

What about adding a `Copy Relative Path` item, which would copy a path relative to current open file? For instance, with the following tree:

```
src/
    services/
        foo/
            Bar.js
    controllers/
        QuzController.js
```

If I am in the `QuzController` file, clicking on this item would put in the clipboard the string `../services/foo/Bar.js`. It would be especially useful as I often count the dot-dot-slash, wasting some development time. :)

data.title: Performance drop AFTER startup
data.body:
Hey guys, 

Been having some sort of every since going to 1.0.0, currently I am on 1.0.2. 

After opening Atom, everything is super responsive for about 15 - 30 seconds then it can't keep up with how fast I'm typing (like with markdown). I ran through the debugging document and didn't see anything really on performance, but maybe I missed something?

Any whose, thanks!

data.title: Special string tokens at end of strings cause another closing quote to be created
data.body:
When I'm typing a string (in any language) that ends in a special token (e.g. `"hi\n"`), another closing quote is inserted when I type a closing quote:
![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7763597/8689621/06108922-2a5f-11e5-8de8-00212d27e2c7.gif)
(The screencast uses JavaScript, but I've seen the issue in enough languages that I think it's not an issue with any one language package.)

data.title: [Bug] Several language fonts (Japanese, Chinese, Hebrew, ...) not displaying in Ubuntu 14.04+ with Atom v1.0.2
data.body:
Does anyone use Atom with foreign characters (e.g. Japanese)? I found one post on this, but no one had replied (https://discuss.atom.io/t/japanese-encoding/17871)

Is there a package to install or something? I have Japanese Anthy installed, so I can type Japanese characters in other programs (LibreOffice, Chrome, etc), and I'm saving in UTF-8. Just in Atom these characters appear as squares.

data.title: HAML comment line leaves subsequent line italic
data.body: In HAML with Rails, if I comment out a line with -# or / or // the subsequent line in italics and some text greyed out as well.

data.title: RTL Support
data.body:
I love atom, but the RTL support is lacking, not sure if this is just me, could be a problem with webkit instead.

To replicate, throw the following into a YML file in Atom, put the cursor halfway in either of the Arabic sentences, and hit backspace.

Expected: The character RIGHT of the cursor be deleted as we are going RTL
Seen: Cursor picks the identical opposite end of the line and deletes there instead

Example with numerals instead:
Line:                            `123456789`
Place cursor:               `1234567|89`
Hit backspace result:   `134567|89`
Expected:                    `1234567|9`
The corrosponding opposite end of the line is edited.

``` YML
ar:
  shared_metatag:
    description: "Import from US online stores"
  guide:
    title: دليل فيشيزفاست
    h1: دليلك للتعرف على عالم التسوق عبر الإنترنت
```

data.title: :memo: Mark Package class as Extended, so that it appears in the docs.
data.body: Several functions on the [PackageManager docs page](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.0.2/PackageManager) return objects of type `Package`. The docs link to the address https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.0.2/Package, which does not exist as `Package` is not marked as an extended class (thus no docs page is generated for it). This PR makes `Package` an extended class so that the docs links are no longer broken.
